content:
Use the cross-lingual intent model to get a unified view of intent performance for all languages defined for a bot. The model allows you to test utterances in any supported language, before or after adding the language to your model.

Einstein Bots is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Setup for Einstein Bots is available in Lightning Experience.
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

To build and manage Einstein Bots:
To build and manage intent sets and bot training:
Customize Application
OR
Modify Metadata
OR
Manage Bots
OR
Manage Bots Training Data

Beginning the week of October 30, 2023, newly created or cloned bots default to the cross-lingual intent model.

Building an intent model with Einstein Bots is supported in multiple languages. To turn on the model for a bot, the bot must have at least two intents and at least one utterance per intent per language.

To turn on the intent model or switch between intent models, deactivate your bot.
From the Einstein Bots Setup page, click the name of your bot to launch the Bot Builder.
Select Overview.
In the Settings section, select Use the Cross-Lingual Intent Model with this bot.
Add at least one utterance. You can add utterances manually, or with tools like Conversation Mining and Input Recommender.
Turn on the Einstein toggle on the dialog.
On the Model Management page, click Build Model.

After you successfully build your model, you can test it using the Input Tester on the Model Management page.
title: Einstein Bots Cross-Lingual Intent Model
